Topic.Title: Absolutely Nothing In The Tech Press About Nvidia

Message.Msg: Yes, it's exactly the same concern I expressed right after CES. Tegra 4 might be cool SoC, but there has been no device using it announced. Of course, except NVIDIA's own Shield and some obscure tablet maker. Where is Asus, Acer, LG, Sony, HTC, ...? We got some Nexus rumours last days, but only god knows if those have some merit. HTC M7 was also supposed to have Tegra 4 inside, but recent rumours talk about Snapdragon instead.

Topic.Title: Absolutely Nothing In The Tech Press About Nvidia

Message.Msg: The customers decide when any news is divulged. Jen does not care about short term traders in the least bit. Nividia is innovating in many areas and long term investors will be rewarded.

Topic.Title: Absolutely Nothing In The Tech Press About Nvidia

Message.Msg: Jen is more than a year late in getting his Tegra business profitable.

Topic.Title: Absolutely Nothing In The Tech Press About Nvidia

Message.Msg: It does appear that Nvidia is about to double down on Cloud Gaming with Nvidia Grid and Project Shield. But I'm afraid Investors eyes will glaze over. They want sexy new smartphones with LTE powered by Nvidia Tegra processors and Icera modems. The Irony is Nvidia will make very good margins on Gaming....like their discrete GPUs, pro graphics, HPC teslas. Tegra in tablets. Much more so than from Tegra in mobile phones. So we are left with earnings and guidance. Stock buyback or no Stock buyback, and yes we can dream dividend increases....to move the stock. P.S. All the technical traders are foaming at the mouth about a run up into earnings. Above the 50 day SMA already plus the 200 day SMA is near at $12.85. An earnings beat of $0.04 from lower taxes is guaranteed. Now just how are they going to guide? If they are aggressive and say "Yes we can to themselves" and guide above expectations then the stock will pop up above 13 and stay there after earnings, rather than drop back as usual. Don't get me wrong...I like the "No More Hype Nvidia" and we don't talk to the "Tech Press" see you at earning Call!

Topic.Title: Between QCOM, Apple, Samsung the ARM smartphone market is locked up.

Message.Msg: "Your dialogue is painful." one side dead set on pumping and the other side dead set on bashing, both regardless of nvda's biz realities. Nvda realities in the mobile market (same as txn's realities btw, but then txn has biz managers who would adjust their investments based on biz realities): 1. Tablet - with no access to aap, samsung and amzn dead set on cheap only, nvda won the whole 'non of the above' market last Q and still lost $40M. This Q, after X'mas, winRT launch, losses should go over $100M. And this reality isn't going to change. 2. Phones - again, with no access to aapl and samsung, nvda's accessible market, even assuming they will get Grey a whole year later, is highly limited. No, qcom has not gotten the market locked up - brcm is ramping app processor/radios integrated solutions at samsung like crazy this year. That the diff. between brcm/txn and nvda - one has a real biz plan thought out carefully in advance and will adjst strategies as the biz evolves, the other is just throwing stuff, very expensive R&D stuff, onto a wall to see if it will stick. BTW Denver - that's more $ down the drain. No chance at server, now re-targeting 'hpc market'. There will be 10 elephants all trying to target one tiny phone booth. Even if nvda wins that whole market, it will not pay for the R&D. That's highly unlikely - given that all of nvda's will-be competitors are cpu guys while nvda isn't. Yes, I expect there will be more of those very intelligent, mature 'Stupid' one word responses from both sides on this post.

Message.Title: intc's problem can become nvda's problem too
Message.Msg: Intc, without the push from amd, has not been pushing out faster products at cheaper prices for a while now. There is just no incentive to upgrade anymore. now that amd is pretty much 'amd managed' out to oblivion, if nvda does not keep pushing out new products at lower price points, nvda can face intc's problem too. No competition is not good, not good for consumers, not even good for the guy with the monopoly.

Topic.Title: So where's the Tegra #4 orders?

Message.Msg: If the Tegra #4 turns out to be the commercial failure it's shaping up to be, maybe the toy Shield could claim "exclusive" use of the Tegra #4. You know. Like the Genuine Apple iPad claims the A6X chip. Exclusively. Maybe that's why Jen wisely put the Tegra #4 and the toy Shield in the same cost center? The "Consumer Products Business" (CPB) he calls it. To avoid those nasty inter-departmental Bazooka wars. Yes boys, Bazooka wars. Which Always break-out whenever one division uses the parts made by another division. "Inter-company cost transfer" the accountants call. "We've been scre.wed" the losing side of the Bazooka war calls it. Let's take an example, shall we? The toy Shield department will use the Tegra #4 for their processor, right? Just like Jen ordered it would. Now, the toy Shield department 'cuda bought any perfectly good mobile processor -- like from Intel or Samsung or Qualcomm or Broadcom or MediaTech or TI -- on the open market, for like $18 bucks. But instead they must buy the Tegra #4 as Jen ordered. "Take one for the team, boys", Jen probably said. So the toy Shield department is thinking their cost should be around the market price of $18 bucks for the Tegra #4. "Oh no no no." Says the Tegra #4 department. Since we've got Tons and Tons and Tons of Tegra #4 development expenses, -- and no Real customers, other than our sister toy Shield department of course -- our actual cost is $7,846.57 per chip. But we can maybe take 10% off for being our best customer. Here's our bill. Are you starting to see the core problem in the Bazooka war here? So Jen, being a highly experienced, well-versed veteran in the accounting problems created by Failed semiconductor projects, wisely put the Tegra #4 and the toy Shield in the same cost center. And Presto! The shared P&L -- the Consumer Products Business -- for both departments suck. Did I mention? Jen is a highly experienced, well-versed veteran in the accounting problems created by Failed semiconductor projects.

Best called Jen out -- right here on this very message board. And shamed Jen into it. You can read and re-read the epic Words of Best, here on Yahoo! Finance. Where is will be carefully preserved for posterity. Just copy into the Search bar at the top : Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend. Personally, I've made Best's posting about the lack of a dividend into a desktop icon. As well it should be.

Topic.Title: intc's problem can become nvda's problem too

Message.Msg: What you say is fundamentally untrue. Intel's biggest competitor has always been all its old chips which is why it has to spend so much money on producing a brand new design every year and a new smaller process every two years. It gets no money from licensing so it has to sell new products each and every year and has to make the new products attractive enough to make customers want to buy them to replace their older products. It's not subsidized by phone carriers like all the smartphone vendors. It's a never ending semiconductor treadmill and Intel is the best at it.

Topic.Title: intc's problem can become nvda's problem too

Message.Msg: 'INtel wanted to own x86' Intel invented x86 and I don't see Nvidia giving out its patents for free lol. The only reason AMD and VIA are hanging on like limpets to Intel's x86 is that IBM originally wanted second sources but those IBM PC days are long gone but they managed to wangle legal decisions to keep that original agreement going until the end of time when it is not really relevant now 30 years later. Maybe when Nvidia licenses its gpu technology to *anybody* who wants it you might sound a little less hypocritical ;-).

Topic.Title: intc's problem can become nvda's problem too

Message.Msg: Fair enough...but I already knew your points... And it does look better for INtel that AMD & VIA are still around otherwise INtel would be sole source of x86... if not becoming already...
